programme.title: Accidental Activist
programme.desc: Accidental Activist charts Paul Vienneau's journey from injury to recovery and disability rights activism. the documentary paints a portrait of a complicated man who unintentionally discovered his true calling.

programme.title: Ça me regarde

programme.title: Rendez-vous politique surprise
programme.desc:
Elizabeth May, Green Party MP and Cathy McLeod, Conservative MP explore the pros and cons of the Trans Mountain Pipeline expansion and its impact on Indigenous and non-Indigenous communities across British Columbia.

programme.title: Attitude
programme.desc:
Always an active person, Tiffiney Perry continued participating in sports and achieving success after a spinal cord injury in her 20s. Now she and husband Chris support others to enjoy the benefits of sport.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Attitude
programme.desc:
Carlos Biggeman is an award-winning photographer, he's about to publish a book of his work. He was born with Down syndrome, but doesn't see it as a barrier.

programme.title: The Last Fur Trader
programme.desc:
In the early 1950s, In Last of the Fur Traders he returns to the Arctic to share his footage. Hugh Kroetsch worked on the Arctic Ocean as a Hudson's Bay Company engineer and filmed his travels.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Chris Kosh: Make Life Happen
programme.desc:
Chris Koch is a pretty normal guy. He is a traveller, farmer, motivational speaker and athlete. He has dived with sharks, run marathons and hitchhiked solo across Canada. You name it, he has probably done it.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Attitude
programme.desc:
Georgia Heard thought she had parenting all mapped out. But when the younger of her two boys was diagnosed with severe Autism at 15 months old, her journey took an unexpected turn.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Attitude
programme.desc:
Pieta Bouma was just 19 years old when she broke her back while living in Ecuador. Nearly two years on she's immersed in student life, finding new ways to enjoy old loves, and becoming a strong voice for the community.
Année : 2011
